Tracks have full tags (including embedded thumbnail)
AMG Bio.txt
AMG Review.txt
info.txt (which is simply these notes included in the torrent)

First biography paragraph from All Music (by Richie Unterberger):

One of the best and most original rockers of the early '60s, Del Shannon was also one of the least typical. Although classified at times as a teen idol, he favored brooding themes of abandonment, loss, and rejection. In some respects he looked forward to the British Invasion with his frequent use of minor chords and his ability to write most of his own material. In fact, Shannon was able to keep going strong for a year or two into the British Invasion, and never stopped trying to play original music, though his commercial prospects pretty much died after the mid-'60s.

Read all of the bio at: <a href=" http://www.allmusic.com/artist/del-shannon-p5407/biography" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://www.allmusic.com/artist/del-shannon-p5407/biography</a>

All Music Album Review (by Stephen Thomas Erlewine):

Greatest Hits features 20 tracks from Del Shannon's early-'60s heyday, including all of the big hits -- "Runaway," "Hats Off to Larry," "Little Town Flirt," "Handy Man," "Keep Searchin' (We'll Follow the Sun)," "Stranger in Town" -- plus a generous selection of lesser-known but equally fine singles and album tracks. Completists should fill in the gaps with his neglected gem I Go to Pieces, but Greatest Hits remains a definitive retrospective from one of the finest pre-Beatles rockers of the '60s.

Taken from: <a href=" http://www.allmusic.com/album/greatest-hits-rhino-r17838" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://www.allmusic.com/album/greatest-hits-rhino-r17838</a>
